channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed
channel.description: Positive news stories from around the world, filtered by sentiment analysis

item.title: Clive Palmer suggests Steven Bannon hoped to ‘increase influence’ by claiming credit for 2019 election ads
item.description: Clive Palmer has denied Steve Bannon helped direct his advertising blitz in the 2019 federal election, suggesting texts published in the Jeffrey Epstein files about the strategy were an attempt by the former Trump strategist to “increase his own influence” by claiming credit.

item.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

item.title: How an 'honest mistake' upended tennis player's Australia Open dream
item.description: Australian Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for receiving a 500 millilitre vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.title: NT residents feel less safe despite government's crime crackdown, report finds
item.description: A government report has found a reduction in how safe Northern Territory residents felt when alone in 2024-2025.

item.title: Teaching our kids they have the ability to say no empowers them with better reasons to say yes | Myke Bartlett
item.description: One of the most frustrating aspects of parenting is having to force your kids to do something they will undoubtedly enjoy.

item.title: Government pledges 10,000 new foster care places in England
item.description: Fostering rules will be relaxed and red tape cut to create 10,000 new places for vulnerable children in England, the government says.

item.title: Cadel: Lungs on Legs review – a heart-pumping, hilarious portrait of an Australian cycling champion
item.description: It’s been 15 years since Cadel Evans rode into Paris in the yellow jersey, becoming the first Australian to win the Tour de France and one of only three non-Europeans ever to claim cycling’s greatest prize.

item.title: Albanese government to sell off $3bn worth of historic defence sites amid push to free up space for new homes
item.description: The federal government will sell off $3bn in historic defence properties around the country, after a major audit of government land holdings and amid efforts to open up land for new housing development and public spaces.

item.title: The latest Epstein files are tarnishing and toppling powerful figures in the U.K.
item.description: Epstein's photos and emails have already prompted King Charles to strip his brother Andrew of his title "prince." Now, they've prompted one of Britain's top diplomats — Peter Mandelson — to step down.

item.title: Adventurer's high praise for 13yo boy and his mum after miracle WA rescue
item.description: A survival expert says calm, rational decision-making was key to a family's survival after they were swept out to sea off WA's South West.

item.title: Residents burnt out of 'paradise' determined to rebuild
item.description: John Cochrane steps through the ruins of his family home, spotting familiar belongings that lie among the ash and rubble.

item.title: 'We hope' Savannah Guthrie's mother is still alive, sheriff says
item.description: More than 48 hours since the mother of US news anchor Savannah Guthrie was reported missing, law enforcement officials are still seeking clues in the disappearance of the 84-year-old from her home in Tuscon, Arizona.

item.title: LIV golfers to start earning ranking points for top 10 finishes
item.description: Members of the breakaway LIV Golf league will now be able to receive Official World Golf Ranking points for finishing in the top 10 of specific tournaments.

item.title: Original Nintendo Switch passes the DS to become Nintendo's bestselling console
item.description: Switch 2 has already beaten the Wii U and is on its way to overtaking GameCube.

item.title: New home, new outlook? What’s next for the Sundance film festival?
item.description: Sundance is over.

item.title: Jacob Bethell dismantles Sri Lanka tail to deliver T20 series clean sweep for England
item.description: It was a thriller on a Pallekele turner, the game going England’s way.

item.title: England beat Sri Lanka by 12 runs in third T20 to complete 3-0 series win – live
item.description: Theekshana c Dawson b Bethell 2 Bethell the hero! Denied a fourth wicket by a review, he soon induces a top edge which is safely held by Dawson at backward point.

item.title: Black sesame is growing more popular in the US. Is it actually good for you?
item.description: In many parts of Asia, black sesame is an essential dessert flavor.

item.title: Pennines delight as drone survey offers hope for one of UK’s rarest birds
item.description: Deep in the Cumbrian Pennines, walkers might be lucky enough to spot small birds with spindly legs, long beaks and bodies like feathered balls hopping through the peat bogs.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn confident she can compete at Olympics despite ‘completely ruptured’ ACL
item.description: Lindsey Vonn said she is “confident” she can compete at the Milano Cortina Winter Games despite revealing she has been managing a ruptured ACL, maintaining that her Olympic comeback remains on track after a crash last week raised fresh doubts over her participation.

item.title: From the moon landing to accidental sexting: your greatest ever TV moments
item.description: Television turns 100 this year, so the Guardian charted our pick of the biggest TV moments from a century of television.

item.title: It’s the Epstein files deja vu: how many more powerful men knew about his crimes, and helped him out anyway? | Marina Hyde
item.description: Like a lot of women, I do vaguely care about the latest political implosion of Peter Mandelson – but I think we’re all massively more obsessed with the fact that there really was a network of incredibly famous and powerful men trying to help a known ex-con minimise and wave away his underage sex crimes.

item.title: 'Effervescent' FKA Twigs' journey to Grammy success
item.description: Standing on a stage and clutching a Grammy as the world watches on is, arguably, the zenith of stardom.

item.title: From Bradbury to Bright: five of Australia’s best Winter Olympic moments | Martin Pegan
item.description: The most unlikely of triumphs that spawned its own catch phrase.

item.title: Don’t let nostalgia cloud your judgment: some of the best picture books are actually the newest | Kate Temple
item.description: The 1980s were a great time to write a classic Aussie picture book.

item.title: The Muppet Show review – we all deserve a brief bit of happiness right now
item.description: The Muppet Show celebrates its 50th anniversary this year.

item.title: Russian hits Ukraine energy sites in 'most powerful blow' so far this year
item.description: Russia has launched its "most powerful blow" against Ukraine's energy sector so far this year, according to the private energy company, DTEK.

item.title: 5 papers from the Super Bowl of Economics
item.description: For most Americans, the Super Bowl is this Sunday.

item.title: Doctor Who fans get chance to bid for famous props
item.description: Fans of long-running BBC sci-fi series Doctor Who are being offered "the chance to own a piece of television history" at an online auction of "iconic" memorabilia.

item.title: ‘I was still black the next morning’: Halle Berry says Oscar win didn’t change her career
item.description: Halle Berry, the only black woman to have won the best actress Oscar, says her 2002 victory “didn’t necessarily change the course of my career”.

item.title: Iranians seeking to punish ruling elite go after the next best thing -- their kids
item.description: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.

item.title: It’s the Hollywood sensation we’re all enjoying: cinema megastars lured to a TV screen near you | Fiona Sturges
item.description: Shrinking, the TV series about Jason Segel’s Jimmy, a grieving psychotherapist who can’t stop telling patients what he really thinks, seems pretty innocuous on paper.

item.title: UK shoppers buy more fruit and yoghurt in healthy start to 2026
item.description: Britons started 2026 by buying more healthy food such as fruit and yoghurt as they attempted to hit new year health goals, while grocery price inflation eased to the lowest level since April, research has shown.

item.title: Musk firms SpaceX and xAI merge to make world's most valuable private company
item.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX is taking over his artificial intelligence (AI) start-up, as the billionaire continues to unify some of his many business interests.

item.title: Starmer has little to offer voters of either right or left in Gorton and Denton. That’s why he’s facing a perfect storm | Owen Jones
item.description: Labour’s soul is being laid bare in the Gorton and Denton byelection campaign.

item.title: The Good Society by Kate Pickett review – the Spirit Level author takes stock
item.description: If you’ve written a successful book based around one big idea, what do you make the next one about? Back in 2009, Kate Pickett’s The Spirit Level (co-authored with Richard Wilkinson) argued that inequality was the ultimate cause of almost all our social problems, from obesity and teenage pregnancy to violent crime; more equal societies, they claimed, had better outcomes across the board.

item.title: Iran’s president seeks ‘fair and equitable negotiations’ with the United States
item.description: The comments on Tuesday from reformist President Masoud Pezeshkian represent the first clear signal from Iran that it may take part in negotiations being organized by Turkey.

item.title: Iran’s president says Tehran ready to pursue ‘fair’ talks with US
item.description: Iran’s president said on Tuesday that he had instructed his foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US, as the two countries reportedly prepared to send top envoys to Istanbul for high-stakes talks on the Iranian nuclear programme later this week.

item.title: Football, politics and protest: This year’s Super Bowl comes at a tinderbox moment in the US
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Don’t tune into the Super Bowl hoping for a break from the tumultuous politics gripping the U.S.

item.title: Researchers hope 'spas' and 'saunas' could save the world's frogs
item.description: Scientists are using man-made frog 'spas' and 'saunas' in a world-first attempt to reintroduce a frog species to the ACT, nearly 50 years after it went locally extinct.

item.title: Hero teen 'passed out' after open-ocean swim to save family
item.description: Austin Appelbee, his mother and two siblings were swept out to sea off Quindalup in WA's South West.

item.title: Ultra-processed foods should be treated more like cigarettes than food – study
item.description: Ultra-processed foods (UPFs) have more in common with cigarettes than with fruit or vegetables, and require far tighter regulation, according to a new report.

item.title: ‘Deepfakes spreading and more AI companions’: seven takeaways from the latest artificial intelligence safety report
item.description: The International AI Safety report is an annual survey of technological progress and the risks it is creating across multiple areas, from deepfakes to the jobs market.

item.description: Scientists have reintroduced green and golden bell frogs to the Australian Capital Territory for the first time since the species became locally extinct four decades ago.

item.title: Epstein files reveal Peter Mandelson supported campaign to undermine then-Australian PM Kevin Rudd’s mining super profits tax
item.description: A former UK Labour minister supported a campaign to undermine the Rudd Labor government’s proposed mining super profits tax in Australia, a document published in the latest tranche of the Epstein files reveals.
